definitions.definition: ( now chiefly dialectal ) An ailment , ache .
( informal ) An ill-tempered or nasty person.
examples: Billy-Bob is a nasty old crank ! He chased my cat away.

definitions.definition: A twist or turn of the mind; caprice ; whim ;
A fit of temper or passion.
( informal , British , dated in US ) A person who is considered strange or odd by others, and may behave in unconventional ways.
examples: John is a crank because he talks to himself.

definitions.definition: ( informal ) An amateur in science or other technical subjects who persistently advocates flawed theories.
examples: That crank next door thinks he’s created cold fusion in his garage.

definitions.definition: ( archaic , baseball , slang , 1800s ) A baseball fan .
( obsolete ) A sick person; an invalid.

main_definition: ( now chiefly dialectal ) An ailment , ache .
secondary_definitions: ( informal ) An ill-tempered or nasty person.
A twist or turn of the mind; caprice ; whim ;
A fit of temper or passion.
( informal , British , dated in US ) A person who is considered strange or odd by others, and may behave in unconventional ways.
( informal ) An amateur in science or other technical subjects who persistently advocates flawed theories.
( archaic , baseball , slang , 1800s ) A baseball fan .
( obsolete ) A sick person; an invalid.

definitions.definition: A bent piece of an axle or shaft , or an attached arm perpendicular , or nearly so, to the end of a shaft or wheel, used to impart a rotation to a wheel or other mechanical device; also used to change circular into reciprocating motion, or reciprocating into circular motion.
examples: I grind my coffee by hand with a coffee grinder with a crank handle.

definitions.definition: The act of converting power into motion, by turning a crankshaft .
examples: Yes, a crank was all it needed to start.

definitions.definition: Any bend, turn, or winding, as of a passage.

examples: Danny got abscesses from shooting all that bathtub crank .

definitions.definition: A twist or turn in speech; word play consisting in a change of the form or meaning of a word.

main_definition: A bent piece of an axle or shaft , or an attached arm perpendicular , or nearly so, to the end of a shaft or wheel, used to impart a rotation to a wheel or other mechanical device; also used to change circular into reciprocating motion, or reciprocating into circular motion.
secondary_definitions: The act of converting power into motion, by turning a crankshaft .
( archaic ) Any bend, turn, or winding, as of a passage.
( rare ) A twist or turn in speech; word play consisting in a change of the form or meaning of a word.
